title: 'Deepest condolences': EAM attends Khaleda Zia's funeral; hands PM Modi‚Äôs letter to son Tarique
content: India's external affairs minister S Jaishankar conveyed Prime Minister Modi's condolences to BNP Acting Chairman Tarique Rahman in Dhaka following the passing of former PM Begum Khaleda Zia. Jaishankar highlighted Zia's significant influence on India-Bangladesh ties and expressed optimism for future partnership development. India is officially participating in the funeral rites.

title: Nimesulide painkiller ban: Centre bars oral formulations over 100 mg, cites health risks
content: The central government has imposed an immediate ban on the manufacture, sale and distribution of all oral formulations of the painkiller nimesulide containing more than 100 mg in immediate-release form, citing risks to human health and the availability of safer alternatives. The decision, taken under the Drugs and Cosmetics Act after expert consultation, was notified by the health ministry. Separately, the ministry proposed changes to the Drugs Rules, inviting public feedback within 30 days.

title: Pandya power: All-rounder goes on rampage; helps Baroda put 417 in Vijay Hazare
content: The platform was laid by openers Nitya Pandya and Amit Pasi, who put together a 230-run stand for the first wicket. Nitya scored 122 from 110 balls, while Pasi made 127 from 93 deliveries, taking Hyderabad‚Äôs bowlers out of the game early.

title: Turkey arrests 125 IS suspects; coordinated raids across 25 provinces
content: Turkey has detained 125 suspected Islamic State members in nationwide raids across 25 provinces. These operations follow a deadly clash in Yalova where three police officers and six IS members were killed. The interior minister vowed to confront those threatening national unity with state might.

title: Neuralink and parenting: Meta AI chief Alexandr Wang on kids; will wait until Neuralink advances
content: Meta's AI head, Alexandr Wang, revealed he will delay having children until advanced brain-computer interface (BCI) technology like Neuralink is widely available. Wang believes children's early neuroplasticity offers a prime window for intuitive BCI integration, potentially enabling future generations to learn and utilize superintelligence tools more effectively than adults.

title: Happy New Year 2026: 30+ Wishes, images, greetings, quotes and more
content: As 2025 concludes, the article offers a collection of greetings, wishes, and quotes to celebrate the arrival of 2026. It provides various ways to express hope, joy, and new beginnings for loved ones and social media. The content aims to make the transition into the new year special for everyone.

title: TOI Habit Index: India‚Äôs 2025 entertainment split - Netflix nights, reel breaks
content: India's screen time is dominated by OTT content, with Netflix leading viewership. Short-form videos like reels also capture significant attention, driven by a desire for relaxation and entertainment. Viewers are increasingly aware of digital fatigue, aiming to reduce aimless scrolling and screen time.

title: Republic Day 2026: Animal contingent to march on Kartavya Path ‚Äî Camels, dogs to debut
content: India's 2026 Republic Day parade will showcase the Army's animal contingent, featuring Bactrian camels, Zanskar ponies, raptors, and dogs. This historic display highlights their crucial role in extreme terrains, emphasizing endurance, sacrifice, and India's growing self-reliance in defence capabilities. The parade underscores the integration of tradition and innovation in military operations.

title: Aadhaar‚ÄìPAN linking deadline ends today: How to link, penalty and other details
content: Linking your PAN card with Aadhaar is crucial to avoid penalties. The Income Tax department's portal guides you through a simple online process involving your PAN and Aadhaar numbers, followed by an OTP verification. Failure to link by December 31, 2025, will render your PAN inoperative, impacting tax refunds and leading to higher tax deductions and collections.

title: IB curriculum is not a shortcut: Study abroad expert explains what really matters for admissions
content: The International Baccalaureate (IB) program equips students with valuable skills for global university admissions, fostering critical thinking and independence. While respected, it doesn't guarantee entry into top universities, especially in the US, which employs a holistic review. The UK system often shows a clearer advantage for IB students due to its structured comparison with A-levels.

title: Smooth deliveries on New Years eve? Zomato, Swiggy hike payout to gig workers
content: Zomato and Swiggy are increasing incentives for delivery partners on New Year's Eve. This comes as gig workers plan a nationwide strike on December 31, 2025. Unions are demanding better pay and working conditions. The strike aims to disrupt services during a busy period. Workers seek restoration of old payout structures and removal of 10-minute delivery.

title: 'Skills, patience and passion exemplary': PM Modi on Arjun Erigaisi's World Blitz bronze
content: Prime Minister Narendra Modi congratulated Grandmaster Arjun Erigaisi for winning bronze at the World Blitz Championships in Doha. Erigaisi's achievement, following his World Rapid bronze, highlights India's growing prowess in chess. The Prime Minister lauded Erigaisi's skills and passion, stating his success will inspire the youth.

title: Tesla promise: Musk's big commitment to company; shares his next five-year plan
content: Elon Musk affirmed his commitment to remaining Tesla CEO for at least the next five years during a recent appearance at the Qatar Economic Forum. This statement comes despite calls from some investors, like Ross Gerber, for his departure due to perceived neglect of Tesla's business amidst his other ventures.

title: Telecom relief: Cabinet clears package for Vodafone Idea, freezes AGR dues at Rs 87,695 crore
content: The Union Cabinet has approved a relief package for Vodafone Idea, freezing Rs 87,695 crore in AGR dues and rescheduling repayment over 10 years from FY32 to FY41.

title: 'World stands with you, Matto': Damien Martyn in induced coma, battles meningitis
content: Damien ‚Äã‚Äã‚ÄãMartyn was also part of Australia‚Äôs triumphant 2003 ODI World Cup squad, playing a decisive role in the final against India with an unbeaten 88 in a match-winning partnership with Ricky Ponting. ‚Äã‚Äã‚ÄãHe retired from international cricket in 2006 during the Ashes series and has largely kept a low profile since.

title: Candace Owens highlights new claims after eyewitness details on Charlie Kirk death
content: Candace Owens says Mitch Snow‚Äôs claims about Charlie Kirk‚Äôs death need verified timelines, not assumptions. Snow, a retired Army medic, says he was at Fort Huachuca and saw key figures. Online users question his memory and details. No official proof confirms his account. Owens asks for solid evidence to settle the debate.

title: 'Dhurandhar' BO collection day 27 Vs 'Tu Meri Main Tera Main Tera Tu Meri' day 7
content: Ranveer Singh's 'Dhurandhar' continues its phenomenal run, crossing Rs 715 crore by its 27th day. In stark contrast, Kartik Aaryan and Ananya Panday's 'Tu Meri Main Tera Main Tera Tu Meri,' released on Christmas, struggles significantly, failing to reach Rs 30 crore even after its first week. The spy thriller's success overshadows the romantic comedy's performance.

title: Khaleda Zia‚Äôs funeral: Thousands gather in Dhaka to pay last respects ‚Äî live updates
content: Bangladesh mourns the passing of former Prime Minister Khaleda Zia, a pivotal political figure, with a public holiday and three days of state mourning. Thousands gathered for her funeral in Dhaka, attended by regional leaders including India's external affairs minister S Jaishankar. Her death marks the end of an era for the influential BNP chairperson.

title: Gurgaon-Faridabad road: Woman gang-raped, assaulted & thrown out of moving van; gets 12 stitches on face
content: A 25-year-old woman was allegedly raped and assaulted by two men after accepting a lift in a van on the Gurgaon-Faridabad road. She was held captive for nearly three hours and then thrown from the moving vehicle, sustaining severe facial injuries. Police have detained two suspects following a complaint.

title: When will a total solar eclipse, the blood moon & the ring of fire appear in 2026
content: 2026 promises a celestial spectacle with four eclipses, including a rare "ring of fire" and a total solar eclipse visible from mainland Europe. This year marks the beginning of a busy period for skywatchers, with significant lunar and solar events clustering together. Planetary alignments also grace the night sky, offering repeated reasons to look up.

title: New Year alert in Rajasthan: 150kg explosives, batteries and wires seized from car; 2 arrested
content: Police intercepted a car on the Tonk‚ÄìJaipur highway, seizing approximately 150kg of ammonium nitrate hidden in urea sacks. Also recovered were 200 explosive batteries and 1,100 meters of electric wire. Two men, identified as Surendra and Surendra Mochi, were detained for questioning regarding the chemical's origin and intended use.

title: Faridabad woman gang-raped in moving van: 2 accused arrested; Maruti Eco seized
content: Two men have been arrested in connection with the alleged gang rape and assault of a 25-year-old woman in Gurgaon. The victim was reportedly held for three hours in a moving van and then thrown out with severe injuries. Police seized the vehicle and registered an FIR following a complaint from the victim's family.

title: Water contamination kills 3 in Indore: Hospitals see rush of patients
content: Three people died in Indore's Bhagirathpura area after consuming contaminated water, with over 15,000 residents affected by diarrhoea and vomiting. The contamination was traced to a newly constructed toilet dumping waste into a sinkhole above a water supply line joint. Authorities are flushing pipelines and supplying water via tankers while investigating the incident.

title: ‚ÄòToo drunk to walk? We‚Äôll drop you home‚Äô: Karnataka plans rescue drops for New Year
content: Karnataka government will provide transport for heavily intoxicated individuals to their homes on New Year's Eve, with 15 resting locations set up. Special attention is being given to women's safety and preventing drink-driving, with over 20,000 police personnel deployed across the state.

title: How to get access to Gemini Pro, ChatGPT Go and Perplexity for free
content: Leading tech giants are making advanced AI tools accessible in India. Google, in partnership with Jio, offers Gemini Pro free for 18 months. Airtel customers receive a 12-month Perplexity Pro subscription at no cost. OpenAI is also providing ChatGPT Go free for 12 months to eligible Indian users, significantly expanding AI access nationwide.

title: Are cold water baths in winter, a badge of good health, a wellness dare or just a bad idea?
content: Winter cold water baths are trending as a sign of toughness. Experts advise a balanced view, debunking myths about immunity and fat burning. While some find mental strength, certain individuals with health conditions should avoid them. Gradual, controlled exposure is key. True health lies in understanding personal limits, especially during winter.

title: Trailing a scream, cops foil suicide, save youth; to be rewarded
content: Two beat officers in Patel Nagar responded to a woman's screams, discovering her son attempting suicide. They raced upstairs, forced open a locked door, and found the young man hanging. The officers quickly cut him down, saving his life just in time before he was rushed to the hospital.

title: Jerrssis Wadia: Tipped as 'next Travis Head', shipped to Adelaide from Vadodara | Exclusive
content: Watched by Tim Paine in a T10 tournament in Melbourne, Indian-origin batter Jerrssis Wadia‚Äôs fearless hitting has fast-tracked his rise in Australian cricket. From losing his U-19 years to COVID to smashing a 16-ball 34 in the BBL, the Mumbai-born 24-year-old is now tipped as the 'Next Travis Head' in South Australia.

title: 'Weakened negotiating position': Cong demands clarity on China's role in Op Sindoor
content: Congress has questioned the Centre's silence after China claimed to have mediated between India and Pakistan during the May tensions. Leader Jairam Ramesh stated China's claim contradicts India's stance and undermines national security, especially given China's alignment with Pakistan.

title: Investment planning: Stocks, FDs, gold, crypto & more ‚Äî your smart money guide to 2026
content: Financial assets in 2026 will be shaped by central bank actions and trade deal prospects, amidst expected volatility. Investors should approach stocks with caution, while gold and silver are poised for continued gains. Mutual funds are set to cross $1tn AUM, and bond yields may rise.

title: India's future XI: Meet the young talents eyeing Olympic glory
content: India's sporting future shines bright as a new generation of athletes emerges, poised for the 2028 Los Angeles Olympics. Boxers Hitesh Gulia and Jaismine Lamboria, long jumper Shaili Singh, and shooter Suruchi Phogat are among the promising talents making waves.

title: 'Remove 10 mins delivery option': Gig workers launch nationwide strike on New Year's Eve
content: Gig workers are demanding the removal of 10-minute delivery options and the reinstatement of earlier payout structures ahead of a nationwide strike. Thousands of workers are participating, citing unsafe pressure and reduced earnings due to changes in payment systems and algorithm-driven management. The protest, organized by IFAT, aims to address these concerns and secure social security benefits.

title: Spanish grape-eating ritual: Can eating 12 grapes on New Year‚Äôs Eve bring love, luck in 2026?
content: A Spanish New Year's Eve tradition, 'Las Doce Uvas de la Suerte,' involves eating 12 grapes at midnight for good fortune. This custom, originating in late 1800s Madrid, has a modern social media twist: eating grapes under the table for amplified luck and manifesting love, luck, and prosperity.  Pop culture and viral stories highlight its perceived effectiveness.

title: Samajwadi Party leader Amrendra Nishad shot by cousin; accused held
content: Samajwadi Party leader Amrendra Nishad narrowly escaped an assassination attempt by his cousin, Ravindra Nishad, who allegedly fired a shot at him at his Gorakhpur residence. The bullet missed Nishad's chest, and the accused has been taken into custody. Investigations are underway following the incident.

title: Kennedy Center row: Name change to Trump prompts concert cancellations; artists pull out
content: Renaming the Kennedy Center to include Donald Trump's name has sparked artist cancellations, including the jazz ensemble The Cookers.  Critics deem the move illegal and damaging to JFK's legacy. Trump allies, now controlling the board, dismiss the boycotts as politically driven, while some artists cite racism and cultural destruction as reasons for their withdrawal.

title: British Indian high achievers recognised in King‚Äôs New Year Honours
content: Several individuals of South Asian heritage have been recognized in the King's New Year Honours List 2026 for significant community contributions. Notable recipients include Meera Syal and Meena Upadhyaya, who received damehoods. The list also features CBEs, OBEs, and MBEs awarded to those making a difference in charity, business, education, and the arts.

title: Haryana horror : Suitcase with woman‚Äôs body found on roadside
content: A disturbing discovery was made in Haryana's Kaithal district as a woman's body was found stuffed inside a blue suitcase in a drain. Farmers alerted authorities after noticing dogs with the luggage. The unidentified victim, believed to be around 30, showed signs of strangulation.

title: 'What's happening in B'desh can happen in India too': Hindu Raksha Dal members hand out 250+ swords
content: Ghaziabad police have registered an FIR against Pinky Chaudhary of Hindu Raksha Dal and 45 associates for allegedly distributing swords and weapons in Shalimar Garden. Ten members were arrested, while Chaudhary and others fled. The incident caused fear and disrupted public peace, with police recovering numerous weapons. Chaudhary cited security concerns for Hindus as justification.

title: Sexual assault case in Canada: Catholic priest from Kerala arrested
content: A Catholic priest from Kerala, Fr. James Cherickal, serving in Toronto, has been arrested in Canada on charges of sexual assault and sexual interference. Peel Regional Police laid the charges on December 18. The Archdiocese of Toronto has removed him from pastoral ministry, emphasizing his innocence until proven guilty and entitlement to due process.

title: Assam couple burnt alive on witchcraft suspicion; villagers claim they caused harm
content: A couple was brutally attacked and burnt alive in their home in Assam's Karbi Anglong district by villagers who suspected them of practicing witchcraft. Police are investigating the horrific incident, which highlights the deep-rooted superstition prevalent in the area. Witch hunting is a criminal offense under state law.

title: Australia cricket great Damien Martyn in induced coma
content: Former Australian cricketer Damien Martyn has been hospitalised and placed in an induced coma after being diagnosed with meningitis. The 54-year-old, a prominent player for Australia in Tests and ODIs, fell ill on Boxing Day. Friends and former teammates have sent their well wishes and prayers for his recovery.

title: Silver price crash today: White metal plunges Rs 15,000 ‚Äî what's the outlook?
content: Precious metals concluded 2025 with a retreat as investors locked in profits near record highs. Silver futures saw a significant 6% drop, while gold futures also edged lower. Despite the late pullback, both metals are poised for historic annual gains, supported by geopolitical tensions but potentially capped by Fed rate cut expectations.

title: Aviation milestone: Dhruv-NG civilian helicopter completes 1st flight in Bengaluru
content: Hindustan Aeronautics Limited's new Advanced Light Helicopter Dhruv-NG successfully completed its inaugural flight in Bengaluru, signaling a significant stride for India's civil aviation manufacturing. This upgraded, twin-engine helicopter boasts enhanced safety, performance, and passenger comfort, powered by indigenous Shakti engines.  The milestone flight aims to boost civil and export markets, with extensive testing planned.

title: Pakistan: Asim Munir marries daughter to brother‚Äôs son; top officials in attendance
content: Pakistan army chief Asim Munir's daughter recently married her cousin, Abdul Rehman, in a subdued ceremony in Rawalpindi. The event saw attendance from top political and military figures, including the President and PM.

title: NFL futures: Seattle Seahawks enter Week 18 as Super Bowl favorites
content: Through 17 weeks of the NFL season, the  Seattle Seahawks  are the new favorites to win the Super Bowl 60, following the  Los Angeles Rams 's loss on "Monday Night Football." The Rams drop to second, as three NFC West teams sit in the top four. The AFC West-winning  Denver Broncos  have the third-best odds to win the Super Bowl at +700. The  San Francisco 49ers  at +850 and the AFC East champion  New England Patriots  at +900. The Seahawks and 49ers meet in Week 18. Note: Odds by  DraftKings Sportsbook  and subject to change.

content: the 2025 bowl season is in full swing, and college football experts are here to highlight the best performances from each of the 36 bowl games . we'll pick the best MVPs from each game from Dec. 13 to Jan. 2 . Payne broke a tackle and tight-walked the sideline before breaking free for a game winning score .

title: Free agent pickups: Look to Saints, Titans amid Week 18 uncertainty
content: the 17th and penultimate Sunday of the season featured excellent performances by new England Patriots QB Drake Maye, Cincinnati Bengals RB Chase Brown and New Orleans Saints WR Chris Olave . the Patriots and Seattle Seahawks each won their 13th game; the Las Vegas Raiders lost their 14th game .

title: ACC preview: Final Four contenders, more March Madness predictions
content: the 18-team league received its lowest number of NCAA bids in more than a decade . it hasn't been a top-three conference since before 2020 . the ACC had eight top-40 teams in 2019 compared to last season's four .

title: ‚ÄòCarefully planned‚Äô: Russia shares video of 'strike' on Putin residence; watch
content: At TOI World Desk, our dedicated team of seasoned journalists and passionate writers tirelessly sifts through the vast tapestry of global events to bring you the latest news and diverse perspectives round the clock. With an unwavering commitment to accuracy, depth, and timeliness, we strive to keep you informed about the ever-evolving world, delivering a nuanced understanding of international affairs to our readers. title: After emphatic win over title rivals, Arsenal can dare to dream once more
content: Steve Nicol makes arsenal premier league title favorites after emphatic win over Aston Villa . the win was more than just a 4-1 victory . it answers a valid question of their journey to this point: could they actually beat one of their rivals for the title?

title: The good, bad and ugly: Big wins for Falcons, Niners, but what happened to Steelers, others?
content: the Texans beat the Chargers to clinch a third consecutive playoff berth for the first time in franchise history . quarterback Derrick Henry carried the Ravens to victory over the Packers . the Bucs and Panthers both lost to set up a matchup for the NFC Souvenir .

title: Our 2025 All-Rookie Team: We picked standout first-years at every single position
content: all rookies make bad plays, and peak performances are weighed fairly heavily . this list is based on the bulk of positive plays . it's the right time to summarize some seasonlong performances . we turn our eyes to the race to super Bowl LX .

title: Our NBA cheat sheet for 2026: Big questions, awards picks and All-NBA rosters
content: there have been scandals (yes, plural ) that have cast a shadow over multiple franchises . there has been one ignominious ending for an all-time great in Chris Paul . we created a cheat sheet to get you caught up on everything that has happened across the NBA over the past few months .

title: Premier League summer transfer overperformers: Madueke, Xhaka lead the way
